analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gang dka' ba'i 'du shes kyis dka' ba spyad pa spyod par mi byed do //
translated: a bodhisattva does not practice austerities with the notion that they are difficult.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: dka' ba'i 'du shes bskyed na ni sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams kyi don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' ba'i 'du shes bskyed na ni sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams kyi don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if you generate the idea of difficulty, you will not be able to benefit countless, limitless sentient beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @96b pos sems can rnams la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha'i 'du shes dang / ma'i 'du shes dang / bu'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @96b pos sems can rnams la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha'i 'du shes dang / ma'i 'du shes dang / bu'i 'du shes dang / bdag gi 'du shes bskyed nas /
translated: however, bodhisattva great beings, with regard to sentient beings, should generate the idea of father, the idea of mother, the idea of son, and the idea of self, but not by apprehending anything.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: They should generate the mind of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: dper na / bdag bdag ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med cing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dper na / bdag bdag ces bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med cing mi dmigs so //
translated: For example, ‘self’ and ‘self’ are completely and totally nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la'ang 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i chos rnams la'ang 'du shes bskyed par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, you should generate the idea with regard to inner and outer phenomena.

original: gal te de ltar 'du shes bskyed na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar 'du shes bskyed na /
translated: If you generate the idea in that way,

original: dka' ba'i 'du shes skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dka' ba'i 'du shes skyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will not develop the idea that it is difficult.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du chos de dag nye bar mi len cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du chos de dag nye bar mi len cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not appropriate and do not apprehend those dharmas in any way at all.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: kho bo ni skye ba med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do; ;bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yod par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni skye ba med pa la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par mi 'dod do; ;bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yod par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that the Tathāgata exists in nonproduction, nor do I assert that the unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening exists.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that the Tathāgata turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang chos gang yang 'thob pa med do //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang chos gang yang 'thob pa med do // de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: And no dharma that is not produced is attained.”🔽The venerable Śāradvatīputra having said that, the venerable Su­bhūti addressed him as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: ci khyod ma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob par 'dod dam /
analyzed: ci khyod ma skyes pa'i chos kyis 'thob par 'dod dam /
translated: “Do you assert that something unarisen is attained?

original: 'on te skyes pa'i chos kyis chos 'ga' zhig 'thob par 'dod //
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa'i chos kyis chos 'ga' zhig 'thob par 'dod //
translated: Or do you assert that something arisen attains something?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'dod @97a *//
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang 'thob par mi 'dod @97a *//
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽I do not assert that something unarisen is attained.

original: la; skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang chos gang yang 'thob par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: la; skyes pa'i chos kyis kyang chos gang yang 'thob par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that something arisen attains something.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci 'thob pa'ang med /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci 'thob pa'ang med /
translated: Śāradvatīputra asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: mngon par rtog pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: mngon par rtog pa'ang med dam /
translated: is there no attainment and no clear realization?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'thob pa'ang yod /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'thob pa'ang yod /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang yod mod kyi /
translated: there is attainment and there is clear realization,

original: gnyis kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of duality.

original: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: However, Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du dmigs so //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du dmigs so //
translated: attainment and clear realization are observed in terms of worldly convention.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad du 'dogs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'ang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha snyad du 'dogs so //
translated: Similarly, a stream enterer is also a conventional designation in terms of worldly convention.

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa'i bar dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi bar dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, up to a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha, and a perfect complete Buddha are also conventional designations in terms of worldly convention.

original: don dam par ni 'thob pa'ang med /
analyzed: don dam par ni 'thob pa'ang med /
translated: In the ultimate, there is no attainment,

original: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med pa nas /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'ang med pa nas /
translated: no clear realization,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i bar du med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i bar du med do //
translated: up to no perfect complete Buddha.

original: smras pa / ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / ci tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha dad kyi don dam par ni ma yin nam /🔽smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha dad kyi don dam par ni ma yin nam / smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: just as attainment and clear realization are conventional designations in terms of worldly convention, so too the five kinds of beings are differentiated in terms of worldly convention, but not in the ultimate.

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is just so.

original: de ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi /
analyzed: de ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du 'dogs pa de kho na bzhin du 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du tha dad kyi /
translated: Thus, just as attainment and realization are designated in mundane convention, so too the five types of reincarnating beings are different in mundane convention.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the five destinies are differentiated in terms of worldly convention, but not ultimately.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe @97b dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe @97b dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: don dam pa la ni las med /
analyzed: don dam pa la ni las med /
translated: in the ultimate truth there is no karma,

original: rnam par smin pa med /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med /
translated: no ripening,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med /
translated: no affliction,

original: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and no purification.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci chos ma skyes pa skye'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci chos ma skyes pa skye'am /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,🔽is it the unborn that is born,

original: 'on te skyes pa nyid skye /
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa nyid skye /
translated: or is it that which is already born that is born?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Su­bhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos la skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni ma skyes pa'i chos la skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that an unborn phenomenon is born.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: chos gang gi ma skyes pa la skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: chos gang gi ma skyes pa la skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: what dharma do you not wish to arise, since it has not arisen?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; gzugs ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu; gzugs ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, I do not wish the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of unarisen form to arise.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Similarly, I do not wish the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of unarisen feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness to arise.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: kho bo ni byang chub kyi bar du ma skyes pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni byang chub kyi bar du ma skyes pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: in the same way, I do not wish the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of unarisen awakening to arise.”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Śāradvatīputra asked, “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ci skye ba skye'am /
analyzed: ci skye ba skye'am /
translated: is it arising that arises,

original: 'on te skye ba med pa skye /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba med pa skye /
translated: or is it nonarising that arises?”

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: skye ba'ang mi skye la /
analyzed: skye ba'ang mi skye la /
translated: arising does not arise,🔽and nonarising does not arise.

original: skye ba med pa'ang mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'ang mi skye'o //
translated: Non-arising also does not arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar skye ba gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba gang yin pa dang / skye ba med pa gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: it is because those two dharmas, namely, arising and non-arising, are neither conjoined nor disjoined,

original: gzugs med pa /🔽bstan du @98a *//
analyzed: gzugs med pa / bstan du @98a *//
translated: are formless,🔽cannot be indicated,

original: med pa / thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa / thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and have a single defining characteristic, which is no defining characteristic.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: for that reason

original: skye ba yod pa'ang mi skye la /
analyzed: skye ba yod pa'ang mi skye la /
translated: arising also does not arise,

original: skye ba med pa'ang mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'ang mi skye'o //
translated: and non-arising also does not arise.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽khyod chos ma skyes so //🔽chos ma skyes so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / khyod chos ma skyes so // chos ma skyes so //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Venerable Su­bhūti,🔽are you bold enough to say🔽‘a dharma has not arisen’

original: zhes bya bar brjod par spobs sam /
analyzed: zhes bya bar brjod par spobs sam /
translated: and ‘a dharma has not arisen’?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: The venerable Su­bhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: khyod chos ma skyes so //
analyzed: khyod chos ma skyes so //
translated: You have not produced the Dharma.

original: chos ma skyes so //
analyzed: chos ma skyes so //
translated: You have not produced the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba'i skye ba med pa brjod par spobs sam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skye ba med pa brjod par spobs sam /
translated: Do you have the courage to say that there is no production?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Su­bhūti addressed the venerable Śāradvatī­putra as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽kho bo ni chos ma skyes so //🔽chos ma skyes so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / kho bo ni chos ma skyes so // chos ma skyes so //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra!🔽I have the courage to say that I have not produced the Dharma.

original: zhes bya bar brjod par spobs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar brjod par spobs so //
translated: I have the courage to say that I have not produced the Dharma.🔽I have the courage to say that there is no production.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽chos ma skyes so //🔽chos ma skyes so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu / chos ma skyes so // chos ma skyes so //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra!🔽I have the courage to say that I have not produced the Dharma.🔽I have the courage to say that I have not produced the Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba'i skye ba med pa'ang brjod par spobs so //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i skye ba med pa'ang brjod par spobs so // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: I have the courage to say that there is no production.🔽If you ask why, Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: it is because,

original: skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang dag yin pa dang / mi skye ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: skye ba med pa gang yin pa dang / spobs pa gang yin pa dang / brjod pa gang dag yin pa dang / mi skye ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, all those phenomena that are non-production, courage, expressions, and non-production are neither fettered nor liberated.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not non-endowed.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: It is formless.

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: It is not shown.

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is unobstructed.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid @98b gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid @98b gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the single characteristic of the absence of characteristics.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this was said, the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: chos de dag kyang ma skyes /
analyzed: chos de dag kyang ma skyes /
translated: Those phenomena are unborn.

original: spobs pa'ang ma skyes /
analyzed: spobs pa'ang ma skyes /
translated: Eloquence is unborn.

original: brjod pa'ang ma skyes pa yin la /🔽gang dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: brjod pa'ang ma skyes pa yin la / gang dag las brtsams te /
translated: Expression is unborn.🔽Those from which you begin to express

original: khyod brjod pa de dag kyang ma skyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: khyod brjod pa de dag kyang ma skyes pa yin nam /
translated: are also unborn.

original: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: ” He replied, “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Those phenomena are unborn.

original: spobs pa'ang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa'ang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Eloquence is unborn.

original: brjod pa'ang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'ang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Expression is unborn.

original: gang dag las brtsams nas /
analyzed: gang dag las brtsams nas /
translated: Those from which you begin to express

original: kho bo brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: kho bo brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: “Those dharmas of which I am confident in speaking are also non-arisen.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni ma skyes pa yin /
translated: it is because form is non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni ma skyes pa yin /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du mig ma skyes pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig ma skyes pa nas /
translated: Similarly, the eyes are non-arisen, and so on up to:

original: yid kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: yid kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin /
translated: the mind is non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du sa'i khams ma skyes pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i khams ma skyes pa nas /
translated: Similarly, the earth element is non-arisen, and so on up to:

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin /
translated: the consciousness element is non-arisen.

original: lus kyi 'du byed dag ni ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dag ni ma skyes pa yin /
translated: Bodily volitional factors are non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du ngag gi 'du byed dag dang / yid kyi 'du byed dag ni ma skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag gi 'du byed dag dang / yid kyi 'du byed dag ni ma skyes pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, verbal volitional factors and mental volitional factors are non-arisen.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to the knowledge of all aspects is non-arisen.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnam grangs des na brjod pa de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na brjod pa de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: For this reason, those statements are also unarisen.

original: spobs pa'ang ma skyes pa'o //🔽gang dag las brtsams te /
analyzed: spobs pa'ang ma skyes pa'o // gang dag las brtsams te /
translated: Eloquence is also unarisen.

original: kho bo @99a *//
analyzed: kho bo @99a *//
translated: Those dharmas that I would begin to speak🔽eloquently about

original: brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang ma skyes pa'o // de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /
translated: are also unarisen.

original: chos smra ba rnams kyi mchog tu gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams kyi mchog tu gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “The venerable Su­bhūti should be considered the foremost of those who expound the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /
translated: It is because the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: gang dang gang kho na dris pa de dang de kho na tshul bzhin du rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽smras pa / de de bzhin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang kho na dris pa de dang de kho na tshul bzhin du rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro // smras pa / de de bzhin te /
translated: whatever he is asked about, responds appropriately and in detail.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ” He replied, “That is so!

original: chos thams cad ni mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni mi brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because all dharmas are non-apprehensible.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus yang tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus yang tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽“Venerable Subhūti,🔽

original: chos thams cad mi brten pa gang yin /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi brten pa gang yin / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatī­putra said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Venerable Su­bhūti, what are all phenomena that are not dependent?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: ” The venerable Su­bhūti replied, “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: gzugs rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: gzugs rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa ni nang la mi brten /
translated: form, which is empty of an inherent essence, is not dependent on the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: is not dependent on the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and is not dependent on both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa ni /
translated: in the same way, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, which are empty of an inherent essence,

original: nang la mi brten /
analyzed: nang la mi brten /
translated: are not dependent on the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: are not dependent on the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and are not dependent on both.

original: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein as before,

original: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni nang la mi brten /
translated: They do not rely on the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: nor do they rely on the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i @99b bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i @99b bar la mi brten to //
translated: nor do they rely on both.🔽Similarly, forms, sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are empty of their own intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du gzugs rnams dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg rnams dang / chos rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs rnams dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg rnams dang / chos rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa nyid ni nang la mi brten /
translated: They do not rely on the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: nor do they rely on the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: nor do they rely on both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
translated: the perfection of generosity, which is empty of its own intrinsic nature, does not rely on the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: nor does it rely on the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: nor does it rely on both.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and likewise the perfection of wisdom, which is empty of its own intrinsic reality, does not rely on the internal,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: does not rely on the external,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and does not rely in the intermediate space between the two.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid nas /
translated: Similarly, from the emptiness of internal phenomena

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de ni nang la mi brten /
translated: up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, which are empty of their own intrinsic reality, do not rely on the internal,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: do not rely on the external,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and do not rely in the intermediate space between the two.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de dag ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de dag ni nang la mi brten /
translated: Similarly, the applications of mindfulness, which are empty of their own intrinsic reality, do not rely on the internal,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: do not rely on the external,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and do not rely in the intermediate space between the two.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de dag ni nang la mi brten /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du rang bzhin nyid kyis stong pa de dag ni nang la mi brten /
translated: In the same way, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of a basic nature, and they do not stand in the inner,

original: phyi rol la mi brten /
analyzed: phyi rol la mi brten /
translated: they do not stand in the outer,

original: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i bar la mi brten to //
translated: and they do not stand in between the two.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni mi brten pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni mi brten pa ste /
translated: for these reasons all things are non-abiding,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽tshe dang ldan @100a *//
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro // tshe dang ldan @100a *//
translated: because they are empty of a basic nature.

original: pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar gzugs yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar gzugs yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should thus purify form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: They should purify feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: they should purify , up to and including omniscience.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa las /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in 10,000 Lines

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o ////
translated: The Fourteenth Chapter: On Non-Coming and Non-Going

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
translated: Then all the Śakras, the lords of the gods, and the Four Mahārājas, as many as there are in the great trichiliocosm, gathered in that assembly, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of thousands of koṭis of devas.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha'i bu rab 'thab bral rnams dang / lha'i bu yongs su dga' ldan rnams dang / lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' rnams dang / lha'i bu dbang sgyur rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na tshangs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang tshangs pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na lha'i bu rab 'thab bral rnams dang / lha'i bu yongs su dga' ldan rnams dang / lha'i bu rab 'phrul dga' rnams dang / lha'i bu dbang sgyur rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na tshangs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang tshangs pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
translated: In the great trichiliocosm, all the sons of gods in the Heaven Free from Conflict, the sons of gods in the Heaven of Joy, the sons of gods in the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the sons of gods in the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations, as well as all the Brahmā gods in the great trichiliocosm, had gathered in that very retinue, together with many quintillions of Brahmās.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas gtsang ma'i lha ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang @100b gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na gnas gtsang ma'i lha ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang @100b gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma dag dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to
translated: In the great trichiliocosm, all the gods of the pure realms, together with many quintillions of gods of the pure realms, had gathered in that very retinue.

original: // rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od dang / de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
analyzed: // rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od dang / de bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
translated: The light of the body of the Caturmaharajika gods arises from the ripening of karma.🔽Similarly, the light of the body of the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods arises from the ripening of karma.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs ris nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / de bzhin du tshangs ris nas gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The light of the body that arises from the maturation of the karma of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika gods, and similarly, of the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, and similarly, of the gods from the Brahmakāyika realm up to the Śuddhāvāsa realm, does not approach even a hundredth part of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.

original: stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gi char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a thousandth part.

original: 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It does not approach even a hundred-thousandth part, or even a koṭī-niyuta-śatasahasra-kṛtyā of a part, or even a count, or a fraction, or a comparison, or a simile of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi sku'i 'od ni 'od de dag gi gan na mchog tu snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi sku'i 'od ni 'od de dag gi gan na mchog tu snang ngo //
translated: The light of the Tathāgata’s own body is supreme among those lights.

original: phul dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ste; dper na /
analyzed: phul dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ste; dper na /
translated: It is the best, the most excellent, the most sublime, the unsurpassed, and the highest.

original: dzambu chu bo'i gser gyi gan na sdong dum tshig pa ni lham me ma yin /
analyzed: dzambu chu bo'i gser gyi gan na sdong dum tshig pa ni lham me ma yin /
translated: For example, compared to the gold of the Jambū River, a burned-out log is not radiant,

original: lhan nem yin /
analyzed: lhan nem yin /
translated: not clear,

original: lhang nge ma yin no //
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin no //
translated: and not bright.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i 'od kyi gan na lha thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'od ni lham me ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i 'od kyi gan na lha thams cad kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'od ni lham me ma yin /
translated: In the same way, compared to the light of the Tathāgata’s own natural body, the light that arises from the ripening of the karma of all gods is not radiant,

original: lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ne ma yin /
translated: not clear,

original: lhang nge ma yin gyi /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i 'od ni 'od de @101a *//
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin gyi / de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'i 'od ni 'od de @101a *//
translated: and not bright.

original: dag gi gan na mchog tu snang ngo //
analyzed: dag gi gan na mchog tu snang ngo //
translated: The light of the Tathāgata’s own natural body is supreme among those lights.

original: phul dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
analyzed: phul dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
translated: It is the best, the most excellent, the most sublime, the unsurpassed, and the highest.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Subhūti, “Venerable monk Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is taught in detail.🔽

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
translated: In this great trichiliocosm,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams nas /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams nas /
translated: from the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm of the gods🔽up to the Śuddhāvāsa realm of the gods,

original: gnas gtsang ma'i bar gyi lha ji snyed 'khod pa de dag tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor 'dir 'dus te /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i bar gyi lha ji snyed 'khod pa de dag tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khor 'dir 'dus te /
translated: all the gods have assembled in this assembly in order to listen to the doctrine from the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de'ang nyan par 'dod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa de'ang nyan par 'dod na /
translated: and they wish to hear the teaching of the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya /
translated: How should great bodhisattva beings train in the transcendent perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the transcendent perfection of wisdom of great bodhisattva beings?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
translated: How should great bodhisattva beings train?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika, it is so!🔽

original: koo shi ka /🔽de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung zhig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba dang /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung zhig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba dang /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,🔽therefore listen well and hard and pay attention, and I will tell you the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings, how bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom,

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu @101b phyin pa khyod la bshad par bya'i /🔽lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu @101b phyin pa khyod la bshad par bya'i / lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis ni /
translated: and how they should practice it, by the power of the Buddha, by the blessing of the Buddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyis shig /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyis shig /
translated: Those gods who have not produced the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should produce the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang dag yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang dag yang dag pa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have entered into the faultless,

original: yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi nus so //
analyzed: yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par mi nus so //
translated: they are not able to generate the mind for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gis 'khor ba'i mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis 'khor ba'i mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have cut off the continuity of saṃsāra.

original: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: But if they were to generate the mind for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: kho bo ni de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad mi byed pas de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni de dag gi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad mi byed pas de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: I would not be an obstacle to their wholesome side, and I would rejoice in that,

original: 'on kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la dmigs par bya'o //
translated: but they should focus on qualities that are more exalted than exalted qualities.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: what is that perfection of wisdom?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis gzugs mi rtag par yid la byed do //🔽de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / gnod pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'gyes pa dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis gzugs mi rtag par yid la byed do // de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / gnod pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'gyes pa dang / g-yo ba dang / rab tu 'jig pa dang / 'jigs pa dang /
translated: Here, bodhisattva great beings, with the thought that is the union of the knowledge of all aspects, pay attention to form as impermanent.

original: 'go ba'i nad dang / stong ba dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par gnod pa byed par yid la byed @102a *//
analyzed: 'go ba'i nad dang / stong ba dang / yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / rnam par gnod pa byed par yid la byed @102a *//
translated: Similarly, they pay attention to it as suffering, as without self, as a disease, as a tumor, as a dart, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a plague, as a disaster, as empty, as not to be depended on, and as something that causes harm.

original: de; de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
analyzed: de; de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
translated: They pay attention to it in that way without apprehending anything.

original: rnam par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed do //
analyzed: rnam par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed do //
translated: Similarly, they pay attention to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as impermanent, up to paying attention to them as something that causes harm.

original: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
translated: In the same way, he attends to the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind as impermanent,

original: lhag par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed do //
analyzed: lhag par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed do //
translated: up to and including as harmful.

original: de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag par yid la byed pa nas /
translated: In the same way, he attends to the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element as impermanent,

original: lhag par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed de /
analyzed: lhag par gnod pa byed pa'i bar du yid la byed de /
translated: up to and including as harmful.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: And he does so without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du gzugs zhi ba dang / dben par yid la byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs zhi ba dang / dben par yid la byed de /
translated: In the same way, he attends to form as peaceful and secluded,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: and he does so without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / dben par yid la byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhi ba dang / dben par yid la byed de /
translated: In the same way, he attends to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness as peaceful and secluded,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: and he does so without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhi ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams zhi ba dang /
translated: Likewise, the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and likewise the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are peaceful.🔽

original: dben par yid la byed de /
analyzed: dben par yid la byed de /
translated: Similarly, they should pay attention to the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the thinking mind, and likewise to the earth element, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element as peaceful and🔽isolated.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: And they should do so without apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams @102b cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams su yid la byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams @102b cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams su yid la byed de /
translated: Similarly, they should pay attention to the volitional factors that are conditioned by ignorance,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa nas /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa nas /
translated: and they should do so without apprehending anything.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'byung bar yid la byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'byung bar yid la byed de /
translated: They should pay attention to the arising of the great mass of nothing but suffering,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa nas /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa nas /
translated: and they should do so without apprehending anything.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i bar du yid la byed de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i bar du yid la byed de /
translated: They should pay attention to the cessation of the great mass of nothing but suffering,🔽and they should do so without apprehending anything.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: and he does so without apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams sgom ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, with thoughts connected with the knowledge of all aspects, cultivate the applications of mindfulness,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom pa dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar dang / de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to they cultivate the noble eightfold path, and similarly they cultivate the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sgom ste /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: Furthermore, bodhisattva great beings, with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects, practice the perfection of giving.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
translated: And they practice it by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @103a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @103a *//
translated: Similarly, they practice the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience,

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
translated: And they practice it by way of not apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽'di ltar chos rnams kho nas chos rnams sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe / 'di ltar chos rnams kho nas chos rnams sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: furthermore, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they purify phenomena with just phenomena,

original: yongs su sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: yongs su sbyong bar byed /
translated: and they thoroughly purify them.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed /🔽yongs su khyab par byed /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed / yongs su khyab par byed /
translated: It is completely fulfilled.🔽It is completely pervaded.

original: yongs su rtog par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su rtog par byed de /
translated: It is completely realized.

original: 'di la bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gam bdag gi zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: It is discerned as being without any self or anything of a self.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva great beings’ dedication is not accompanied by the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin la /
translated: The thought of awakening is not accompanied by the thought of dedication.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: the thought of dedication is not in the thought of awakening, and it is not apprehended there.

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs te /
translated: The thought of awakening is not in the thought of dedication, and it is not apprehended there.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad la'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed la /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi chos thams cad la'ang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed la /
translated: This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings, which is the discernment of all phenomena just as they are,

original: chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: and the nonapprehension of any phenomenon at all.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis @103b tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis @103b tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Śakra, King of the Gods, then said to venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,🔽how is the mind of dedication not accompanied by the mind of awakening?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: How is the mind of awakening not accompanied by the mind of dedication?🔽How is the mind of dedication not present in the mind of awakening and not apprehended?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: How is the mind of awakening not present in the mind of dedication and not apprehended?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika, it is so!🔽

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems ma yin zhing /
translated: the thought of dedicating is not a thought,

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
translated: and the thought of awakening is not a thought.

original: sems ma yin pa ni sems ma yin pa la yongs su bsngo bar mi byed la /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa ni sems ma yin pa la yongs su bsngo bar mi byed la /
translated: A non-thought does not dedicate a non-thought,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yongs su bsngo bar mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yongs su bsngo bar mi byed do //
translated: and the inconceivable does not dedicate the inconceivable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar sems nyid gang yin pa de sems ma yin pa nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems nyid gang yin pa de sems ma yin pa nyid yin zhing /
translated: Because that which is the nature of a thought is not a thought,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid sems ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa de nyid sems ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and that which is the nature of the inconceivable is not a thought.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: that is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so //🔽zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so // zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhūti,🔽“Excellent, Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @104a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @104a *//
translated: excellent that you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings

original: ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la spro ba bskyed pa ni legs so //🔽legs so // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la spro ba bskyed pa ni legs so // legs so // de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and encourage the bodhisattva great beings.🔽” The Lord having said that, the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: bdag gis ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag dang / de dag gi nyan thos gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par dga' bar bgyis /
analyzed: bdag gis ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag dang / de dag gi nyan thos gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par dga' bar bgyis /
translated: who delighted the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past when they were bodhisattvas in the six perfections,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du stsal /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod cing btsud de /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du stsal / yang dag par gzengs bstod cing btsud de /
translated: who caused them to take them up,🔽who encouraged them, who introduced them,

original: rab tu bkod pa dag la byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor bar bgyi lags te /
analyzed: rab tu bkod pa dag la byas pa gzo ba dang / byas pa tshor bar bgyi lags te /
translated: and who established them in the six perfections.

original: de la btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: de la btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpar gyur pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
translated: the Blessed One, when he was a bodhisattva, trained in the six perfections and fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la yang dag par dga' bar bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la yang dag par dga' bar bgyi /
translated: In the same way, we too will delight the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bgyi /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bgyi /
translated: we will inspire them,

original: btsud nas rab tu dgod par bgyi lags so //
analyzed: btsud nas rab tu dgod par bgyi lags so //
translated: and we will establish them in them.”

original: bdag @104b cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par dga' bar bgyis /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du stsal /
analyzed: bdag @104b cag gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par dga' bar bgyis / yang dag par 'dzin du stsal /
translated: “We will delight them in the six perfections,🔽we will inspire them,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod nas btsud de /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod nas btsud de /
translated: we will encourage them,🔽and we will establish them in them.

original: rab tu bkod pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so ///
analyzed: rab tu bkod pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so ///
translated: They will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri pa /
translated: Noble Mahāprajñāpāramitā

original: bam po bco lnga pa /🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Fifteenth section

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung zhig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar spyad par bya ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zung zhig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar spyad par bya ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, listen well and take it to heart, and I will explain how bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom and how they should practice.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: form is empty of form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: in this regard, the emptiness of form and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba'i stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba'i stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes kyi stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed kyi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: Similarly, the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, the emptiness of consciousness, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' @105a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' @105a *//
translated: a bodhisattva great being

original: sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong /
translated: further, the eye is empty of the eye,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and similarly, connect this with each,

original: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong /
analyzed: yid kyi bar ni yid kyis stong /
translated: up to the mind is empty of the mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na mig gi stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the eye, up to the emptiness of the mind, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: de ltar gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same vein as before,

original: sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong /
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong /
translated: the earth element is empty of the earth element,

original: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong ste /
translated: and likewise, the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element.

original: de ltar na sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: de ltar na sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the earth element, up to and the emptiness of the consciousness element, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong /
translated: furthermore, ignorance is empty of ignorance,

original: de bzhin du rga shi'i bar ni rga shis stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du rga shi'i bar ni rga shis stong /
translated: and likewise, up to old age and death are empty of old age and death.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gag pa ni ma rig pa 'gag pas stong pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa 'gag pa ni ma rig pa 'gag pas stong pa nas /
translated: In the same vein, the cessation of ignorance is empty of the cessation of ignorance, up to🔽and the cessation of old age and death is empty of the cessation of old age and death.

original: rga shi'i bar du 'gag pa ni rga shi 'gag pas stong ste /
analyzed: rga shi'i bar du 'gag pa ni rga shi 'gag pas stong ste /
