translated: up to the cessation of aging and death is empty of the cessation of aging and death.

original: de ltar ma rig pa 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rga shi'i @105b bar du 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid dang / rga shi'i @105b bar du 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the cessation of ignorance and the emptiness of the cessation of aging and death and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Apply as above.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang sbyar bar bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang sbyar bar bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: Similarly, apply to the perfection of giving, up to apply to the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: Similarly, apply to inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the applications of mindfulness, up to the eightfold noble path.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dang / de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and in the same way, it should be applied to all the meditative stabilizations and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos kyi theg pa la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos la'ang sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos la'ang sbyar bar bya /
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the śrāvakas.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong /
translated: Moreover, the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /🔽de ltar na rnam pa @106a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste / de ltar na rnam pa @106a *//
translated: and the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.🔽Thus, the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid 'di ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so // koo shi ka /
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?🔽The Lord: He should not stand therein as something conditioned, or as something unconditioned, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?🔽The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be realized, or as something not to be realized, etc.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas gzugs la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be attained, or as something not to be attained, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?

original: de bzhin du mig la gnas par mi bya ba nas yid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la gnas par mi bya ba nas yid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be defiled, or as something to be purified, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?🔽The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be grasped, or as something not to be grasped, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?🔽The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be increased, or as something to be diminished, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?

original: mig gi 'das te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bya ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'das te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba la gnas par mi bya ba nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be produced, or as something to be stopped, etc.🔽Subhuti: How, O Lord, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, stand in form, etc.?

original: de bzhin du sa'i khams la gnas par mi bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa'i khams la gnas par mi bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: The Lord: He should not stand therein as something to be seized, or as something not to be seized, etc.🔽Subh

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi @106b bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la gnas par mi @106b bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not dwell on the applications of mindfulness, and so on, up to and they should not dwell on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya ba nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par mi bya ba nas dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not dwell on the result of stream enterer, and so on, up to they should not dwell on the state of a worthy one.

original: rang byang chub la gnas par mi bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub la gnas par mi bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not dwell on a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, and so on, up to they should not dwell on complete buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la gnas par mi bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la gnas par mi bya ba nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi bar la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not dwell on form, and so on, up to they should not dwell on genuinely perfect buddhahood.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: gzhan yang gzugs rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they should not dwell on the notion that form is permanent.

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not dwell on the notion that form is impermanent.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: gzugs bde zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: they should not dwell on the notion that form is happiness.

original: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are suffering.

original: gzugs bdag yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are a self.

original: bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that a self is not a self.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are empty.

original: mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that they are not empty.

original: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are with signs.

original: mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that they are signless.

original: gzugs smon pa yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs smon pa yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms have aspirations.

original: smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: smon pa med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that they are without aspirations.

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are calm.

original: ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma zhi zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that they are not calm.

original: gzugs dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are void.

original: mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi dben zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that they are not void.

original: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun nas nyon mongs zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that physical forms are afflicted.

original: @107a *// rnam par byang zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: @107a *// rnam par byang zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “purification” is not something to be settled on.

original: gzugs kun tu skye zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun tu skye zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Form arises” is not something to be settled on.

original: gzugs 'gag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'gag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Form ceases” is not something to be settled on.🔽“Form is a thing” is not something to be settled on.

original: dngos po med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Form is not a thing” is not something to be settled on.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, “feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are permanent” is not something to be settled on.

original: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Impermanent” is not something to be settled on.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way,

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “consciousness is a thing” is not something to be settled on.

original: dngos po med ces bya ba'i bar du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med ces bya ba'i bar du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Not a thing” is not something to be settled on.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, “the result of stream enterer is distinguished by the conditioned” is not something to be settled on.

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: and that it is revealed by the unconditioned.

original: zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the notion that the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, and the fruit of arhatship are revealed by the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: or that they are revealed by the unconditioned.

original: de bzhin du rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dus byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the notion that the level of a pratyekabuddha and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening are revealed by the conditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: or that they are revealed by the unconditioned.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa ni sbyin gnas so @107b zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa ni sbyin gnas so @107b zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not abide in the notion that one who has entered the stream is a recipient of gifts,

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: Similarly, it should not be based on the thought, ‘The one who is a once-returner, the one who is a non-returner, the one who is an arhat, the one who is a pratyekabuddha, the one who is a bodhisattva, and the one who is a tathāgata is a recipient of gifts.’

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas de ltar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not base themselves in this way.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should not base themselves on the first bodhisattva level.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te; sa bcu pa'i bar la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te; sa bcu pa'i bar la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same vein, they should not base themselves on the tenth level by way of apprehending something.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: gnas pa yod na g-yo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa yod na g-yo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because if there is a basis, there is movement.

original: gzhan yang bdag gis sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag gis sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, I should stand in the first production of the thought and complete the perfection of giving.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I should stand in the first production of the thought and complete the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad @108a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad @108a *//
translated: In the same way, I should stand in the first production of the thought and cultivate the applications of mindfulness.

original: pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i bar du bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, I should stand in the first production of the thought and cultivate the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should cultivate the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand with the notion that they should cultivate the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du bsgom par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand with the notion that they should cultivate the four fearlessnesses of the tathāgatas, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand with the notion that they should enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de'i 'og tu phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de'i 'og tu phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand with the notion that they should then stand in the irreversible level of a bodhisattva.🔽They should not stand with the notion that they should complete the five bodhisattva eyes.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand with the notion that they should complete the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses of the tathāgatas, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag bya ba'i phyir dang / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga po de dag la gnas nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag bya ba'i phyir dang / mchod pa bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings, standing in those five higher knowledges of the bodhisattvas, should go to infinite, countless buddhafields in order to bow down to, honor, respect, and serve the lord buddhas,

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams su 'gro bar bya zhing /
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams su 'gro bar bya zhing /
translated: and in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos de thos nas kyang sangs rgyas de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de 'dra ba dag @108b mngon par sprul par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos de thos nas kyang sangs rgyas de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing de 'dra ba dag @108b mngon par sprul par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: And having heard that Dharma, the bodhisattva great beings should think, ‘I will manifest such buddhafields of those buddhas,’ but they should not stand in that thought.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, they should not stand in the perfection of wisdom by way of apprehending it.

original: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams su song nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams su song nas /
translated: In the same way, they should not dwell on the idea that they will go to countless, immeasurable world systems

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la 'di lta ste /
translated: and make offerings to the tathāgatas, the arhats, the completely perfect buddhas,🔽with hundreds of thousands of quintillions of flowers,

original: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / dri dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ras bcos bu bye ba phrag 'bum dag gis bkur sti bya'o //🔽bla mar bya'o //🔽ri mor bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dang / phreng ba dang / dri dang / byug pa dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ras bcos bu bye ba phrag 'bum dag gis bkur sti bya'o // bla mar bya'o // ri mor bya'o //
translated: garlands, perfumes, ointments, parasols, banners, and flags.🔽They should not dwell on the idea that they will honor them,

original: mchod par bya'o snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //🔽der song nas sems can dpag tu med /🔽grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o /🔽snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o // der song nas sems can dpag tu med / grangs med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o / snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: revere them, and make offerings to them.🔽They should not dwell on the idea that they will go there and establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de bzhin du mig lnga ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig lnga ste /
translated: They should not dwell on the idea that they will go there and establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽“Similarly, they should not dwell on the idea that they will go there and establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the five eyes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig bskyed par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig bskyed par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will generate the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the Dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.”

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad bskyed par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad bskyed par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will generate all meditative absorptions.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gang 'dod pa des brtson par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang 'dod pa des brtson par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will strive in whatever meditative absorption I wish.”

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish all the dhāraṇī gateways.”

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi @109a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi @109a *//
translated: “I will accomplish the ten powers of the tathāgatas.”

original: bya'o // de bzhin du mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // de bzhin du mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, great loving kindness, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.”

original: de bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lus la yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //🔽dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lus la yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o // dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la yongs su bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eight liberations.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eight bases of overcoming.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the ten universal bases.”

original: de bzhin du gang zag brgyad pa la gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag brgyad pa la gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four assurances.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four kinds of exact knowledge.”

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //🔽rgyun du zhugs pa ni de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o // rgyun du zhugs pa ni de ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four forms of unhindered knowledge.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the thirty-two major marks of a superior man on my body.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eighty minor marks on my body.”

original: tshe zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa mgo mnyam du zad pa'i gang zag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshe zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa mgo mnyam du zad pa'i gang zag ces bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eight liberations.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eight bases of overcoming.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the nine serial steps of meditative absorption.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the ten universal bases.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the ten powers of the tathāgatas.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four assurances.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four kinds of exact knowledge.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the four forms of unhindered knowledge.”🔽One should not abide in the notion that “I shall perfect the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.”

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni log par mi ltung ba'i chos can zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni log par mi ltung ba'i chos can zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dwell on the idea that a stream-enterer is one who will not fall into error.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la lan gcig 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par 'gyur ro snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba la lan gcig 'jig rten 'dir 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par 'gyur ro snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dwell on the idea that a once-returner will put an end to suffering after returning once more to this world.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dwell on the idea that a non-returner will attain nirvāṇa there.

original: @109b dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni yang srid pa med do zhes bya ba dang / 'di nyid du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //🔽rang sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: @109b dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa ni yang srid pa med do zhes bya ba dang / 'di nyid du phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro snyam du gnas par mi bya'o // rang sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dwell on the idea that an arhat whose defilements have ceased will not be reborn, or that he will attain nirvāṇa in this very life, in the realm without the remnants of the aggregates.🔽One should not dwell on the idea that a pratyekabuddha is one who attains awakening on his own.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bar gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not dwell on the idea that a perfect buddha is one who attains the state of a perfect buddha.

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yang dag par 'das nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I shall transcend the level of the śrāvakas and the level of the pratyekabuddhas and abide in the bodhisattva stages.”

original: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i ye shes la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i ye shes la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, he should not abide in the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spang bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Having fully and completely awakened to all dharmas in all aspects, I shall abandon all afflictions, all propensities, and all connections.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: “Having fully and completely awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: having become a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha, I shall turn the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams byas nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa rnams byas nas /
translated: Likewise, having performed the deeds of a Buddha,

original: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa @110a *//
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa dag phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa @110a *//
translated: I will cause countless, immeasurable sentient beings to attain final nirvāṇa in the expanse of nirvāṇa without remainder.’🔽“He should not abide with a mind that conceives of the four bases of supernatural powers in this way:

original: bzhi shin tu bsgoms pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: bzhi shin tu bsgoms pa la gnas nas /
translated: ‘I will abide in the cultivation of the four bases of supernatural powers,

original: ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu la snyoms par zhugs na bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ji lta bu la snyoms par zhugs na bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: and I will enter into the meditative absorption such that I will remain for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.’

original: bdag gi tshe'i tshad ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi tshe'i tshad ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: ‘My lifespan will be immeasurable.’🔽“

original: de bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par 'gyur bar bya ste /
translated: In the same way, I will have the thirty-two marks of a great person.🔽Each of the marks of a great person is accomplished by a hundred merits.🔽I will have the eighty minor marks of a great person.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan re re'ang bsod nams brgyas yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan re re'ang bsod nams brgyas yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro // snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Each of the minor marks of a great person is accomplished by a hundred merits.🔽I will have a halo extending a fathom all around me.🔽I will have a voice like that of Brahmā.🔽I will have a voice like that of the kalaviṅka bird.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great Indra’s drum.

original: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa de snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig tu gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I will have a voice like the sound of the great cloud.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great dragon.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great kinnara.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great gandharva.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great garuḍa.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great kiṃnara.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great mahoraga.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great nāga.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great asura.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great deva.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great sage.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great brahman.

original: bdag gi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje las byas par gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje las byas par gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I will have a voice like the sound of the great ṛṣi.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great śrāvaka.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great pratyekabuddha.

original: bdag gi byang chub kyi shing las sems can gang dag dri snom pa de dag gi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug med par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi byang chub kyi shing las sems can gang dag dri snom pa de dag gi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug med par 'gyur zhing /
translated: I will have a voice like the sound of the great bodhisattva.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great tathāgata.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great buddha.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great buddha’s Dharma.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great buddha’s Dharma wheel.🔽I will have a voice like the sound of the great buddha’s Dharma wheel’s spokes.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag mi bskyed par sems can de dag gis dri de mnams pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa kho nar gyur la /🔽de dag la lus kyi nad dam /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems dag mi bskyed par sems can de dag gis dri de mnams pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges pa kho nar gyur la / de dag la lus kyi nad dam /
translated: And may those sentient beings who smell that fragrance be freed from all their physical illnesses,

original: rlung @110b nad dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i dri de lta bu dag 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rlung @110b nad dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i dri de lta bu dag 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: and may they not have any illnesses of wind, bile, or phlegm.

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzugs kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der gzugs kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig /
translated: In my buddhafield, may the word ‘form’ not exist,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: and likewise, may the words ‘feeling,’ ‘conception,’ ‘volitional factors,’ and ‘consciousness’ not exist.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgra 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: May the word ‘perfection of giving’ not exist, and likewise, may the words ‘perfection of morality’ up to ‘perfection of wisdom’ not exist.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi sgra 'ba' zhig 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyi sgra 'ba' zhig 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I should be one who causes the mere sound of the perfection of wisdom to be heard.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar gyur cig ces bya ba de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I should be one who causes the mere sound of the applications of mindfulness to be heard.

original: de bzhin du rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi sgra 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi sgra 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I should be one who causes the mere sound of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha to be heard.

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing der rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces bya ba nas /
translated: I should be one who causes the mere sound of stream enterer to be heard.

original: dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar ma gyur cig snyam du gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: I should be one who causes the mere sound of worthy one and pratyekabuddha to be heard.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'ba' zhig 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'ba' zhig 'byung bar gyur cig snyam du de ltar yang gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: and the sounds of bodhisattva and buddha should occur.

original: le'u bar mar ji snyed bstan pa kho na bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: le'u bar mar ji snyed bstan pa kho na bzhin du 'dir yang de bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same vein, as has been extensively taught in the intermediate chapter, so it should be applied here as well.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: 'di @111a *// ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di @111a *// ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, do not apprehend any phenomena.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos thams cad la gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas chos thams cad la gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: it is in this way that great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom should not abide in any phenomena.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu'i sems sems kyis shes nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, having understood in his own mind the thoughts of the venerable Śāradvatī­putra, said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra, what do you think?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ci la gnas snyam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de ci la gnas snyam /
translated: On what is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha based?”

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The venerable Śāradvatī­putra then said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci la'ang mi gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci la'ang mi gnas pa yin la /
translated: the Tathāgata is not based on anything at all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang ci la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang ci la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is not based on anything at all.

original: de ni gzugs la mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la mi gnas /
translated: It is not based on form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas /
translated: perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams la mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams la mi gnas /
translated: He does not stand in the compounded element.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mi gnas pa nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la mi gnas pa nas /
translated: He does not stand in the applications of mindfulness, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos @111b ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi gnas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos @111b ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la mi gnas /
translated: he does not stand in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mi gnas so //
translated: up to he does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to venerable Śāriputra,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ston pa ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ston pa ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: “Śāriputra,🔽just as the Tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete Buddha, Blessed One, Teacher, does not stand and does not not stand, just so, Śāriputra,

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar chos rnams la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la gnas par bya ste /
translated: One should abide in the Dharma in this way.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: de ltar chos rnams la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la gnas par bya'o //
translated: should abide in the Dharma in this way.”

original: de nas 'khor de las lha'i bu kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de las lha'i bu kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then some gods in the assembly thought this:

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyis gnod sbyin gyi tshig dang / ngag rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod par bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag cag gis shes par rung gi /
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyis gnod sbyin gyi tshig dang / ngag rnams dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod par bya ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag cag gis shes par rung gi /
translated: “We can understand the yakṣa language, speech, expression, sounds, and what is to be expressed by the yakṣas,

original: da ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa dang / brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'grel ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / lung 'bog cing tshig brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag cag gis mi shes so snyam mo //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi @112a *//
analyzed: da ltar tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'chad pa dang / brjod pa dang / ston pa dang / rnam par 'grel ba dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / lung 'bog cing tshig brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni bdag cag gis mi shes so snyam mo // de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi @112a *//
translated: “We do not understand the present teaching, expression, demonstration, explication, clarification, transmission, and verbal expression of the perfection of wisdom by the venerable Su­bhūti.”

original: sems sems kyis shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: sems sems kyis shes nas lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti, having understood in his own mind the thoughts that were in the minds of those gods, said to those gods,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes par mi rung ngam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes par mi rung ngam /
translated: Is it not the case that the perfection of wisdom is not to be known?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag cag gis shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag cag gis shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not to be known by us.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to those gods,

original: kye lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: kye lha'i bu dag /
translated: “O divine princes!

original: khyed rnams kyis thos par 'gyur du yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod ma bstan to //
analyzed: khyed rnams kyis thos par 'gyur du yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod ma bstan to //
translated: You have not heard a single syllable of it, nor have I taught it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge rnams ma yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge rnams ma yin la /
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not syllables.

original: 'di la gang gis thos par 'gyur ba'i nyan pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gang gis thos par 'gyur ba'i nyan pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there is no one at all who could hear it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la ni yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la ni yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the enlightenment of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas is without syllables.

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas shig sprul la des kyang sprul pa mdzad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas shig sprul la des kyang sprul pa mdzad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Divine princes,

original: dge slong gi 'khor dang / dge slong ma'i 'khor dang / dge bsnyen gyi 'khor dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor dag cig sprul la /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'khor dang / dge slong ma'i 'khor dang / dge bsnyen gyi 'khor dang / dge bsnyen ma'i 'khor dag cig sprul la /
translated: for example, a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha conjures up a buddha, and he in turn conjures up a retinue of monks, a retinue of nuns, a retinue of laymen, and a retinue of laywomen.

original: des mngon par sprul nas kyang 'khor bzhi po de dag la chos bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: des mngon par sprul nas kyang 'khor bzhi po de dag la chos bstan par gyur na /
translated: Having manifested himself, he teaches the Dharma to the four assemblies.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: ci 'khor der sems can 'gas kyang chos @112b ci'ang bstan pa'am /
analyzed: ci 'khor der sems can 'gas kyang chos @112b ci'ang bstan pa'am /
translated: Is there any Dharma that is taught by anyone in that assembly,

original: sems can 'gas kyang chos ci'ang thos pa'am /
analyzed: sems can 'gas kyang chos ci'ang thos pa'am /
translated: or any Dharma that is heard by anyone,

original: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /🔽smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam / smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: or any consciousness?

original: ma mchis so //
analyzed: ma mchis so //
translated: They replied, “No, Venerable Subhūti.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

original: chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni sprul pa lta bu ste /
translated: All phenomena are like a magical creation.

original: de dag ni sus kyang bshad pa med cing /
analyzed: de dag ni sus kyang bshad pa med cing /
translated: None of them is taught by anyone,

original: sems can gang gis kyang thos pa med la sus kyang shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: sems can gang gis kyang thos pa med la sus kyang shes pa'ang med do //
translated: nor is any of them heard by anyone, nor is any of them known by anyone.”

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: dper na / rmi lam na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa zhig mthong na /
analyzed: dper na / rmi lam na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa zhig mthong na /
translated: it is just as if one were to see in a dream the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One teaching the Dharma.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: ci de ni sus kyang bshad pa'am /
analyzed: ci de ni sus kyang bshad pa'am /
translated: Is there anyone who teaches there,

original: thos pa'am / kun shes pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: thos pa'am / kun shes pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Do you think that there is any hearing or understanding?

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ma mchis so //🔽smras pa / lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: ma mchis so // smras pa / lha'i bu dag /
translated: there is none.”🔽Subhūti said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Divine princes, it is so!

original: chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu sta /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu sta /
translated: All phenomena are like a dream.

original: de dag ni sus kyang bshad pa med la /
analyzed: de dag ni sus kyang bshad pa med la /
translated: There is no one who explains them,

original: thos pa'ang med /
analyzed: thos pa'ang med /
translated: no one who hears them,

original: kun shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: kun shes pa'ang med do //
translated: and no one who understands them.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: dper na / mi gnyis shig g-yang sa'i bya skyibs shig tu 'khod nas sangs rgyas kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
analyzed: dper na / mi gnyis shig g-yang sa'i bya skyibs shig tu 'khod nas sangs rgyas kyi bsngags pa brjod cing /
translated: it is like two people sitting in a ravine who speak in praise of the Buddha,

original: de bzhin du chos dang / dge 'dun gyi bsngags pa brjod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dang / dge 'dun gyi bsngags pa brjod la /
translated: and likewise speak in praise of the Dharma and the Saṅgha.

original: mi de gnyis kyi tshig gi sgra las brag ca gnyis shig byung na /
analyzed: mi de gnyis kyi tshig gi sgra las brag ca gnyis shig byung na /
translated: If two echoes were to arise from the sound of those two people’s words,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: divine princes,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems ci brag ca'i sgra gcig shos po des brag ca'i sgra gnyis pa thos pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems ci brag ca'i sgra gcig shos po des brag ca'i sgra gnyis pa thos pa'am /
translated: what do you think? Would the second echo hear the first echo,

original: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
translated: or would there be any understanding?

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They replied,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ma mchis so //
analyzed: ma mchis so //
translated: there is none.”

original: snga ma ji lta ba de kho @113a *//
analyzed: snga ma ji lta ba de kho @113a *//
translated: It is just as it was before.🔽

original: na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: na bzhin du rgya cher sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied extensively.

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Divine princes,🔽it is like this:🔽a magician or a magician’s apprentice,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor 'dug nas /
translated: having sat down at the crossroads of a main road,

original: de bzhin gshegs pha dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shig sprul la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pha dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shig sprul la /
translated: would conjure up a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa des kyang sprul pa'i 'khor bzhi po de dag la chos bstan par gyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa des kyang sprul pa'i 'khor bzhi po de dag la chos bstan par gyur na /
translated: and that magical creation of a tathāgata would teach the Dharma to the fourfold assembly that was conjured up.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think about this?

original: ci de la sems can gang gis kyang chos ci'ang bstan pa'am /
analyzed: ci de la sems can gang gis kyang chos ci'ang bstan pa'am /
translated: Would any being at all have taught any Dharma there,

original: sems can gang gis kyang thos pa'am /
analyzed: sems can gang gis kyang thos pa'am /
translated: or would any being at all have heard it

original: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yod snyam mam /
translated: or cognized it?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ma mchis so //
analyzed: ma mchis so //
translated: there would not be.”

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied extensively as before.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /🔽gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te / gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gsal bar byed de /
translated: Then the thought occurred to those gods,🔽“The elder Subhūti is elucidating this perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches zab par 'chad cing /
analyzed: de ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ches zab par 'chad cing /
translated: He is explaining this perfection of wisdom as very profound,

original: ches phra bar ston to snyam mo //
analyzed: ches phra bar ston to snyam mo //
translated: and he is teaching it as very subtle.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems la brtags nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi sems kyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems la brtags nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, having mentally investigated the thoughts of those gods,

original: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to those gods,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods!

original: gzugs ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: Form is not profound, not subtle.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not profound, not subtle.

original: @113b gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: @113b gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: The intrinsic nature of form is not profound, not subtle.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the essence of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not profound and not subtle.

original: de bzhin du gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to

original: phung po dag tu ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du mig la sbyar bar bya ba nas yid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dag tu ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du mig la sbyar bar bya ba nas yid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: just as it was explained in the case of the aggregates, so it is in the case of the eyes, and so it is in the case of , up to and including the mind.

original: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to the eye consciousness, and so it is in the case of , up to and including the mind consciousness.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar bar bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyar bar bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to the perfection of generosity, and so it is in the case of , up to and including the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid la sbyar bar bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid la sbyar bar bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to inner emptiness, and so it is in the case of , up to and including the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la sbyar bar bya ba nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la sbyar bar bya ba nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the applications of mindfulness, and so on, up to the noble eightfold path.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sbyar bar bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sbyar bar bya ba nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to the ten powers of the tathāgatas, and so on, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it should be applied to all the meditative stabilizations and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of all aspects is not profound and is not subtle.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni zab pa ma yin phra ba ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is not profound and is not subtle.

original: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then it occurred to those gods to think,

original: chos bstan pa 'di @114a *//
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di @114a *//
translated: “In this teaching of the Dharma

original: la gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: la gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: there is no designation of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the designations of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness non-existent?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: Are the designations of the perfection of giving,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom non-existent?

original: nang stong pa nyid du btags pa'ang med cing /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid du btags pa'ang med cing /
translated: Are the designations of inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: and up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature non-existent?

original: chos bstan pa 'di la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the designations of the applications of mindfulness up to the eightfold noble path non-existent in this teaching of the Dharma?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur btags pa'ang med cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcur btags pa'ang med cing /
translated: Are the designations of the ten powers of the tathāgatas non-existent,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: and are the designations of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha non-existent?

original: chos bstan pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs par btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs par btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the designations of stream enterer non-existent in this teaching of the Dharma?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the designations of the result of stream enterer non-existent?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub dang /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / rang byang chub dang /
translated: the once-returner and the fruit of the once-returner, the non-returner and the fruit of the non-returner, the arhat and the fruit of the arhat, the pratyekabuddha and the pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa rnams dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: the bodhisattva and the bodhisattva levels, and the perfect, complete awakening of perfect buddhahood and the perfect buddhas themselves?

original: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med @114b dam /
analyzed: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med @114b dam /
translated: Are the designations of the letters also nonexistent?

original: ci zhig gu snyam mo //
analyzed: ci zhig gu snyam mo //
translated: What is this?”

original: de nas che dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas che dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to those gods, “Divine princes!

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de de bzhin no //
translated: Divine princes!

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
